intro: Dirichletia involucrata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil and bright, indirect light. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and red, making it a popular ornamental plant. Dirichletia involucrata is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its adaptability and ease of care.
